get.description: Return a list of backup artifacts.

vendor.description: Database vendor e.g. PostgreSQL, MongoDB, MySQL.

data_model.description: DataModel is a model used for performing a backup.

status.description: BackupStatus shows the current status of execution of backup.

folder.description: Folder to store artifact on a storage.

items.description: Metadata contains extra artifact data like files it consists of, tool specific data, etc.

file_list.description: List of files backup consists of.

items.description: File represents file or folder on a storage.

restore_to.description: Exact time DB can be restored to.

pbm_metadata.description: PbmMetadata contains additional data for pbm cli tools.

name.description: Name of backup in backup tool representation.

parameters.description: Removes all the backup files associated with artifact if flag is set.
parameters.name: remove_files

get.description: Return a list of available MongoDB point-in-time-recovery timeranges.

parameters.description: Artifact ID represents artifact whose location has PITR timeranges to be retrieved.
parameters.name: artifact_id

start_timestamp.description: start_timestamp is the time of the first event in the PITR chunk.

end_timestamp.description: end_timestamp is the time of the last event in the PITR chunk.

filesystem_config.description: FilesystemLocationConfig represents file system location config.
FilesystemLocationConfig represents file system location config.
FilesystemLocationConfig represents file system location config.

post.description: Test a backup location and credentials.
post.summary: Test a Backup Location and Credentials

filesystem_config.description: FilesystemLocationConfig represents file system location config.

get.description: List all backup restore history items

items.description: RestoreHistoryItem represents single backup restore item.

artifact_id.description: ID of the artifact used for restore.

vendor.description: Database vendor e.g. PostgreSQL, MongoDB, MySQL.

data_model.description: DataModel is a model used for performing a backup.

status.description: RestoreStatus shows the current status of execution of restore.

pitr_timestamp.description: PITR timestamp is filled for PITR restores, empty otherwise.

get.description: Get logs from the underlying tools for a restore job

items.description: LogChunk represent one chunk of logs.

post.description:
Could return the Error message in the details containing specific ErrorCode indicating failure reason:
ERROR_CODE_XTRABACKUP_NOT_INSTALLED - xtrabackup is not installed on the service
ERROR_CODE_INVALID_XTRABACKUP - different versions of xtrabackup and xbcloud
ERROR_CODE_INCOMPATIBLE_XTRABACKUP - xtrabackup is not compatible with MySQL for taking a backup
ERROR_CODE_INCOMPATIBLE_TARGET_MYSQL - target MySQL version is not compatible with the artifact for performing a restore of the backup

service_id.description: Service identifier where backup should be restored.

pitr_timestamp.title: Timestamp of PITR to restore to

items.description: ScheduledBackup represents scheduled task for backup.

cron_expression.description: How often backup will be run in cron format.

start_time.description: First backup wouldn't happen before this time.

retries.description: How many times to retry a failed backup before giving up.

retry_interval.description: Delay between each retry. Should have a suffix in JSON: 2s, 1m, 1h.

data_model.description: DataModel is a model used for performing a backup.

vendor.description: Database vendor e.g. PostgreSQL, MongoDB, MySQL.

get.description: List services that are compatible with the backup artifact.

parameters.description: Artifact id used to determine restore compatibility.
parameters.name: artifact_id

items.description: MySQLService represents a generic MySQL instance.

service_name.description: Unique across all Services user-defined name.

node_id.description: Node identifier where this instance runs.

address.description:
Access address (DNS name or IP).
Address (and port) or socket is required.

port.description:
Access port.
Port is required when the address present.

socket.description:
Access unix socket.
Address (and port) or socket is required.

extra_dsn_params.description: Extra parameters to be added to the DSN.

items.description: MongoDBService represents a generic MongoDB instance.

service_name.description: Unique across all Services user-defined name.

node_id.description: Node identifier where this instance runs.

address.description:
Access address (DNS name or IP).
Address (and port) or socket is required.

port.description:
Access port.
Port is required when the address present.

socket.description:
Access unix socket.
Address (and port) or socket is required.

get.description: Get logs from the underlying tools for a backup/restore job.

items.description: LogChunk represent one chunk of logs.

cron_expression.description: How often backup should be run in cron format.

start_time.description: First backup wouldn't happen before this time.

retries.description: How many times to retry a failed backup before giving up.

retry_interval.description: Delay between each retry. Should have a suffix in JSON: 1s, 1m, 1h.

service_id.description: Service identifier where backup should be performed.

folder.description:

Could return the Error message in the details containing specific ErrorCode indicating failure reason:
